abstract: As other high-tech companies cut back on their research labs, Microsoft continues to increase its ranks of free-rein thinkers.
snippet: As other high-tech companies cut back on their research labs, Microsoft continues to increase its ranks of free-rein thinkers.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  As other high-tech companies cut back on their research labs, Microsoft continues to increase its ranks of free-rein thinkers.

headline.main: Microsoft Adds Research Lab in East as Others Cut Back
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Adds Research Lab in East as Others Cut Back

abstract: Google is making an unusually aggressive effort to block Microsoft’s $44.6 billion hostile bid for Yahoo.
snippet: Google is making an unusually aggressive effort to block Microsoft’s $44.6 billion hostile bid for Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Standing between a marriage of Microsoft and Yahoo may be the technology behemoth that has continually outsmarted them: Google.

headline.main: Google Works to Torpedo Microsoft Bid for Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Google Works to Torpedo Microsoft Bid for Yahoo

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: In an industry that favors start-ups, a faint stodginess clings to Microsoft and Yahoo that could impede their  ability to draw top engineering talent.
snippet: In an industry that favors start-ups, a faint stodginess clings to Microsoft and Yahoo that could impede their  ability to draw top engineering talent.
lead_paragraph: The crowds of engineering students stood as many as six deep at the recruitment table Google set up at a job fair at Stanford last fall. Facebook’s representatives faced a similarly thick crowd clamoring for a few minutes of their time.

headline.main: Another Difficulty for a Microsoft-Yahoo Marriage: Recruiting
headline.print_headline: Another Difficulty for a Microsoft-Yahoo Marriage: Recruiting

byline.original: By Gary Rivlin and Katie Hafner

abstract: Standing between a marriage of Microsoft and Yahoo may be the technology behemoth that has continually outsmarted them: Google.
lead_paragraph: Standing between a marriage of Microsoft and Yahoo may be the technology behemoth that has continually outsmarted them: Google.

headline.main: Google Works to Foil Microsoft’s Yahoo Bid

abstract: The weekend was rife with media speculation about Microsoft‘s Yahoo bid and how it could play out. The San Francisco Chronicle wondered about the fates of “dozens” of overlapping Internet services at the two Web giants, and Reuters suggested that a combined Microsoft and Yahoo would be a “Noah’s Ark of a Web company” — one with two of everything. Vindu Goel, writing in the San Jose Mercury News, suggested that integration could be such a distraction that it works in favor of archrival Google.
lead_paragraph: The weekend was rife with media speculation about Microsoft‘s Yahoo bid and how it could play out. The San Francisco Chronicle wondered about the fates of “dozens” of overlapping Internet services at the two Web giants, and Reuters suggested that a combined Microsoft and Yahoo would be a “Noah’s Ark of a Web company” — one with two of everything. Vindu Goel, writing in the San Jose Mercury News, suggested that integration could be such a distraction that it works in favor of archrival Google.

abstract: Google could help keep Yahoo away from Microsoft if it took over selling search ads for Yahoo in return for a very large check. That money could help finance all sorts of possible deals. But taking search out of Yahoo could well destroy a lot of the value in the company.
snippet: Google could help keep Yahoo away from Microsoft if it took over selling search ads for Yahoo in return for a very large check. That money could help finance all sorts of possible deals. But taking search out of Yahoo could well destroy a lot of t...
lead_paragraph: Eric Schmidt, the chief executive of Google, is offering Yahoo — and, it seems, anyone else — whatever help he can to make sure Yahoo isn’t swallowed by Microsoft.

headline.main: How Google Could Keep Yahoo From Microsoft
